themes.title: Scholarship and Symbolism in Chinese Porcelain
points: Discuss the small porcelain objects from Dehua kilns, highlighting their intended use on a scholar's desk and their connection to intellectual pursuits in Chinese history.
Analyze the ivory-colored glaze on Dehua whitewares, emphasizing its cultural significance and why it was highly prized.
Relate the aesthetic qualities of Dehua porcelain to the Yuan dynasty's focus on refinement and scholarly ideals.

themes.title: Blue-and-White Porcelain: Techniques and Legacy
points: Introduce the Chenghua period blue-and-white porcelain bowls, noting their historical importance and association with the Tsui Museum of Art collection.
Explain the technical process behind blue-and-white porcelain production, including the use of cobalt oxide underglaze and firing techniques.
Encourage students to critically analyze the artistic and historical value of Chenghua porcelain, considering its role in commissions for elite patrons.

themes.title: Celadon: Craftsmanship Across Cultures
points: Highlight the Goryeo dynasty stoneware with celadon glaze, noting its 20 cm diameter and the technical skill required to achieve its translucent finish.
Discuss the cross-cultural influence of celadon, tracing its origins in China and its adaptation in Korea during the Goryeo dynasty.
Invite students to compare celadon techniques with other glazing methods, fostering an analytical perspective on craftsmanship and innovation.

themes.title: Commissions and the Role of Patronage
points: Explore how commissions shaped the production of high-quality porcelain, such as Chenghua blue-and-white bowls and Dehua whitewares.
Discuss the relationship between artisans and patrons, focusing on how specific requests influenced design and technique.
Encourage students to critique the impact of patronage on artistic freedom and the evolution of Chinese ceramic traditions.

themes.title: Technical Mastery in Earthenware and Porcelain
points: Explain the differences between earthenware and porcelain, focusing on materials, firing temperatures, and durability.
Analyze the ivory-colored glaze of Dehua whitewares and the celadon glaze of Goryeo stoneware, comparing their visual and tactile qualities.
Discuss how technical mastery reflects broader cultural values, such as refinement, durability, and aesthetic harmony.
